creator: christ1

content: Since you don't use it, you can reduce the disc space by locating the c:users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird folder, which is where accounts and data are stored. That is probably where the large size is. Just delete it. There is also a small set at c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\local\thunerbird, which can also be deleted. Thunderbird, itself, is either in program files or program files(x32). Just delete it. Your system may have used different drives, but I hope this helps you remove it.
creator: davidsk

creator: christ1

content:
If you can store 2 messages you should be able to store at least 2^32 for crying out loud! It's all just 7-bit ASCII FFS!

Maybe, but if you let your Inbox grow to a huge file, it would also take your anti-virus software a huge amount of time to scan your Inbox file every time a new message is received. Anti-virus software is the most likely culprit to cause Thunderbird mail file corruption.

To avoid problems create an exception in your anti-virus software for the Thunderbird profile folder, so that the anti-virus real-time scanner will not scan it. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/profiles-where-thunderbird-stores-user-data#w_how-to-find-your-profile

So how on earth am I going to fix this?

Try to rebuild the index file for Inbox. Right-click the Inbox folder in the folder pane - Properties - Repair Folder

Note, depending on the state of mail file corruption, in the worst case, your messages may already be gone. In that case you can only restore them from a backup created prior to the incident.

It is best practice to keep the Inbox as tidy as possible.
creator: christ1

content:
Since posting my question at 09:30 my principal Thunderbird problem has happened again - it has frozen. I don't know whether it counts as a crash because I never get a crash report request, all that happens is that I get the message Home-Mozilla Thunderbird (Not Responding) and I have to close the programme.

This is one of the problems I was having repeatedly which prompted me to try updating and then uninstaling and reinstalling Thunderbird.

I re-started Thunderbird and now one of my other old problems is happening again - Thunderbird tries to download emails (all my accounts are set to download emails on startup) and works its way down the email accounts but stops before it has completed the list. It's so quick I can't be sure but I think it only looks at about 7 - 10 of my 23 email accounts before stopping.

  • I still have a blank screen.
  • The blank Folder Pane has gone and View\layout has the option for Folder pane greyed out
  • View\All Folders has lost its tick.

Perhaps the weirdest thing - There really are NO folders showing, no Inbox, no Trash, no Drafts, nothing, and of course no Local Folders which is where I have sub-folders with my emails.

I will appreciate any help.

Michael (UK)
creator: Michael-was-suppliers1

content: Suggestions are always welcome. However, this is the support forum and we are only volunteers. To ensure your suggestions are seen by developers, I suggest you go to connect.mozilla.org and select the IDEAS section and post your suggestions there. Thank you for your interest.
creator: davidsk

content:
TheMichiganOldFarmer said
Three things that I feel should be changed in Thunderbird 1. A toggle switch to highlight that we chave received email in a thread. I can spend hours looking for why the folder shows I got an email, yet none of the messages are highlighted.

Threads with new messages can be made more prominent with css:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1442668#answer-1642934

2. When I want something to be opened in a new tab, I want to switch to the new tab. This again can be a toggle.

The default action when a message is opened by Enter or double-click is to put the new tab in focus. The default when a message is opened by the right-click, Open Message In New Tab, or middle-click, is to not put the new tab in focus. The second action can be like the first if Shift is pressed. Shift has no effect on the first action.
creator: sfhowes

content: Your complaint is well understood, since we see it here multiple times daily since threading became the default in summer of 2022. You will find complete instructions here. These have been used by many and the solution does work. But it is time-consuming, I agree. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1439822
creator: davidsk

content: Thunderbird is only an agent; the details relate to the email account itself. So, it may be helpful if you post specifics on the email account, such as screenshot of server settings and SMTP settings.
creator: davidsk

content:
My service provider is Sasktel since I live in Saskatchewan, Canada of which is my internet and email service provider and due to this my server settings are

For incoming IMAP Server mail.sasktel.net Security Type SSL Port 993 and I have tried other ports settings as well that will work including the fact that tech service mentioned others that work.

Correct User name and email address including correct password

Outgoing Server SMPT Server smpt.sasktel.net Security Type TLS Port 587 (with other working Port numbers tried as well)

Require authentication to send emails also selected including normal password security selected as well.

Since Thunderbird accesses my email server it requires the correct Port settings, correct protocol and security settings and of course password for both incoming and outgoing.

Since this is all correct as per the customer technical support rep who also uses Tbird who while on the phone also gave me Port and Security settings. Besides this, they have a website telling what settings to use including myself referring to my Outlook Express in my Microsoft Office Pro for Port and server settings including on my cell, a Samsung Note 20 Ultra and when I change my password on the Sasktel server I have to go in on everything and replace my password. I'm even willing to uninstall Thunderbird and download a fresh copy and for this I would have to do a little research because even though I have been using Linux for a number of years, when it comes to using Terminal or Command Line Interface I have to find out what the proper commands are including proper procedure.
creator: donhenschel
